entries: Lorsque vous lancez ce sort en utilisant un emplacement de sort de 4e niveau ou plus, vous créez un bras supplémentaire pour chaque niveau d'emplacement supérieur au 3e.

spell.name: Spiritwatch

components.m: a handful of cereal grains, a cup of wine, 25 gp worth of incense, which is burned when you cast the spell, and a token of the spirit you are going to summon

entries: Vous invoquez l'esprit d'un humanoïde récemment décédé depuis moins d'un an, ou de l'un de vos ancêtres directs ou parents immédiats décédés, et lui demandez de veiller sur un bien de votre choix. Cela peut être un bâtiment ou une structure, ou un objet inanimé. Un esprit récalcitrant peut effectuer un jet de sauvegarde de Charisme pour résister. Lorsque vous invoquez l'esprit, vous devez disposer d'un objet ayant appartenu à la personne dont vous invoquez l'esprit, comme une image ou une ressemblance, une mèche de cheveux ou un objet personnel (qui peut être le bien que vous lui demandez de garder).

L'esprit n'est pas lié à votre propriété et n'a pas à renoncer à sa propre vie après la mort pour garder votre propriété. Au contraire, l'esprit se met en phase avec votre propriété et est conscient de ce qui s'y passe ou de ce qui se passe autour. Il peut toutefois choisir de se manifester dans son intégralité, bien qu'il soit complètement insubstantiel et ne puisse effectuer aucune action. Lorsqu'il se manifeste, il peut parler à voix haute (mais d'une voix douce) et ne peut pas s'éloigner de plus de 30 pieds de la propriété.

Si des intrus accèdent à votre propriété ou tentent de la voler, ou si la propriété est endommagée d'une manière ou d'une autre, l'esprit vous alertera immédiatement, à condition que vous soyez sur le même plan d'existence. L'esprit a une vision noire de 120 pieds et peut vous donner des détails sur l'apparence physique des intrus ou des voleurs.

Si vous lancez ce sort pour invoquer le même esprit une fois tous les 30 jours pendant un an, l'esprit gardera en permanence la propriété. Si vous lancez l'option Bannissement ou l'option Renvoi de Dissipation du mal et du bien, le sort est rompu et l'esprit est libéré. Vous pouvez également choisir de libérer l'esprit à tout moment en utilisant une action bonus pour le faire.

spell.name: Steal Skill

components.m: a token depicting the skill to be stolen, and a platinum piece, the latter of which is consumed by the spell

entries: Vous touchez une créature et la forcez à faire un jet de sauvegarde de Charisme. En cas d'échec, vous lui volez l'une des compétences, l'un des outils ou l'une des langues de la créature pour la durée du sort. Lorsque ce sort est en vigueur, vous utilisez votre propre bonus de compétence et votre modificateur d'attribut.

Si la cible avait une capacité qui lui permettait d'augmenter son bonus, comme l'Expertise, ou est membre d'une maison marquée du Dragon et obtient un {@dice 1d4} supplémentaire à son jet, vous gagnez également la même capacité.

De plus, tant que ce sort est en vigueur, la cible ne peut pas utiliser son modificateur de compétence lorsqu'elle utilise cette compétence et effectue tous les jets pour celle-ci avec un désavantage.

spell.name: Vander's Librarian

components.m: a pen made of precious materials worth at least 100 gp

entries: Vous invoquez un esprit mineur de la connaissance. Il se manifeste physiquement dans un espace inoccupé que vous pouvez voir à portée. L'esprit a une apparence céleste, féerique ou diabolique (au choix). Son intelligence est de 10 + votre modificateur de capacité de lanceur de sorts et il peut lire, écrire et parler toutes les langues courantes et une langue exotique, choisie par vous lorsque vous lancez ce sort.

Si vous donnez à l'esprit l'accès à du matériel de référence et que vous lui donnez des instructions précises sur ce que vous souhaitez apprendre, il est capable d'effectuer une semaine de recherche en 8 heures (selon le Guide de Xanathar, chapitre 2, Recherche). Vous pouvez également demander à l'esprit d'effectuer l'action Aide pendant que vous faites des recherches, auquel cas vous pouvez effectuer un jet sur la table Résultats des recherches avec un avantage. L'utilisation de ce sort ne vous empêche pas d'avoir à dépenser de l'argent supplémentaire pour les matériaux et autres dépenses nécessaires pendant la recherche.
L'esprit a une classe d'armure de 10. S'il est attaqué ou subit des dégâts, il disparaît et le sort prend fin.

spell.name: Blessed Abundance
entries: Vous touchez n'importe quelle quantité de nourriture qui peut tenir dans un carré de 5 pieds de côté et vous la dupliquez.

Ce sort ne permet pas de dupliquer de la nourriture qui a été délibérément {@condition poisoned} ou altérée (mais il permet de dupliquer de la nourriture qui s'est détériorée normalement, par exemple à cause de l'âge ou de l'infestation par des insectes) ; il ne permet pas non plus de dupliquer des boissons ou des aliments magiques, des animaux vivants, des cadavres entiers, des plantes encore dans le sol ou sur la vigne, ou des minéraux. Vous pouvez cependant dupliquer de la viande crue.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Lorsque vous lancez ce sort avec un emplacement de 6e ou 7e niveau, vous pouvez quadrupler la quantité de nourriture produite. Lorsque vous lancez ce sort avec un emplacement de 8e ou 9e niveau, vous pouvez octupler la quantité de nourriture produite.

spell.name: Create Air

components.m: a glass bottle worth 100 gp and a drop of water

entries: Avec cette sphère, vous créez une bulle de 30 mètres de rayon remplie d'une réserve renouvelable d'air frais, centrée sur la bouteille utilisée comme composant matériel. L'air peut être temporairement pollué par la fumée et d'autres moyens similaires, mais il se dissipe rapidement. L'air émane de la bouteille ; tant que la bouteille est intacte, elle produira de l'air pour la durée du sort. L'air contenu dans la bulle se mêle à l'air ambiant.

spell.name: Moonfire
entries: Vous libérez un faisceau de feu blanc et froid en ligne droite de 60 pieds de long et 10 pieds de large. Les créatures qui se trouvent dans cette zone doivent réussir un jet de sauvegarde de Dextérité. Une créature subit {@damage 7d6} de dégâts de froid (si elle est vivante) ou {@damage 7d6} de dégâts de rayonnement (si elle est morte-vivante) si elle rate son jet de sauvegarde, ou la moitié si elle le réussit.

De plus, une créature qui subit des dégâts du feu de lune, ainsi que tous les objets magiques situés sur la trajectoire du sort, sont soulignés d'une lueur argentée jusqu'à la fin de votre prochain tour. Tant qu'il est délimité, la créature ou l'objet diffuse une faible lumière dans un rayon de 10 pieds et ne peut pas bénéficier de {@condition invisible}, et tout jet d'attaque contre une créature ou un objet affecté a un avantage si l'attaquant peut le voir.

spell.name: Rain of Terror
entries: Vous provoquez une tempête de pluie maudite dans un rayon de 1 mile autour de vous pour la durée du sort. Vous devez être à l'extérieur pour lancer ce sort. Si vous vous déplacez dans un endroit où vous n'avez pas de chemin dégagé vers le ciel, le sort prend fin prématurément.
Lorsque vous lancez ce sort, vous faites tomber du ciel des choses étranges et dégoûtantes (mais inoffensives). Choisissez ou lancez un dé sur la table suivante pour déterminer ce qui tombe.
Tous les animaux sont Tiny et n'ont pas d'attaques. Environ la moitié des animaux seront morts ou mourants à l'impact. Lorsque le sort prend fin, le temps revient brusquement à la normale.

spell.name: Vanquil's Drifting Blizzard
entries: Vous créez une sphère de 20 pieds de rayon de brouillard gris pâle et neigeux centrée sur un point de votre choix à portée. Le brouillard se répand dans les coins. Il dure toute la durée du sort ou jusqu'à ce qu'un vent fort le disperse, mettant ainsi fin au sort. Sa zone est fortement obscurcie.

Lorsqu'une créature entre dans la zone du sort pour la première fois lors d'un tour ou commence son tour à cet endroit, cette créature doit effectuer un jet de sauvegarde de Constitution. La créature subit {@damage 5d8} de dégâts de froid sur un jet de sauvegarde raté, ou la moitié des dégâts sur un jet réussi. De plus, une créature qui échoue à son jet de sauvegarde voit son déplacement réduit de 5 pieds jusqu'à la fin de son prochain tour.

Le brouillard s'éloigne de 10 pieds de vous au début de chacun de ses tours, roulant à la surface du sol. Les vapeurs, étant plus lourdes que l'air, descendent jusqu'au niveau le plus bas du terrain, se déversant même dans les ouvertures. Les vapeurs gèlent également toute zone ouverte de liquide avec laquelle elles entrent en contact.

spell.name: Wall of Bones

components.m: a twig taken from a tree in a cemetery

entries: Vous créez un mur d'ossements de tous types. Le mur apparaît à portée de main sur une surface solide et dure pendant toute la durée. Vous choisissez de faire le mur jusqu'à 60 pieds de long, 10 pieds de haut, et 5 pieds d'épaisseur, ou un cercle qui a un diamètre de 20 pieds et est jusqu'à 20 pieds de haut et 5 pieds d'épaisseur. Le mur bloque la ligne de vue. Les crânes du mur grincent des dents et les mains agrippent et griffent quiconque s'approche.

Lorsque le mur apparaît, chaque créature se trouvant dans sa zone doit effectuer un jet de sauvegarde de Dextérité. En cas d'échec, la créature subit {@damage 5d6} de dégâts tranchants et est {@condition grappled} (DC d'évasion égal à votre DC de sauvegarde contre les sorts). En cas de sauvegarde réussie, la créature subit la moitié des dégâts et n'est pas {@condition grappled}.

Une créature peut traverser le mur, mais lentement et péniblement. Pour chaque 1 pied qu'une créature traverse le mur, elle doit dépenser 4 pieds de mouvement. De plus, la première fois qu'une créature entre dans le mur lors d'un tour ou y termine son tour, elle doit effectuer un jet de sauvegarde de Dextérité. Elle subit {@damage 5d6} de dégâts d'entaille en cas de sauvegarde ratée et {@condition grappled}, ou la moitié, de dégâts en cas de sauvegarde réussie.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Lorsque vous lancez ce sort en utilisant un emplacement de sort de 6e niveau ou plus, les dégâts augmentent de {@dice 1d6} pour chaque niveau d'emplacement supérieur au 5e.

spell.name: Create Room

components.m: a stick of colored chalk, a small model of a house made of stained glass worth 100 gp, and a special component depending on the version of the spell

entries: Vous conjurez le mobilier et l'équipement d'un type de pièce spécifique que vous spécifiez lorsque vous lancez le sort. Ces objets tiennent dans un carré de 6 mètres de côté qui est marqué par la craie, et tout objet qui est retiré de la zone se dissipe en fumée. À la fin de la durée du sort, tout le mobilier disparaît également. Choisissez l'une des options suivantes lorsque vous lancez ce sort :

- {@b Bathing Room.} Cela comprend des toilettes magiques qui se vident toutes seules, une baignoire (que vous pouvez choisir de rendre assez grande pour accueillir de 1 à 4 personnes), un brasero magique qui produit de la chaleur pendant toute la durée du bain, des serviettes, un miroir sur pied et un miroir à main, un ou deux tabourets rembourrés, une ou deux robes de chambre, et des fournitures d'hygiène pour le bain, le rasage, les manucures et les pédicures. Le composant matériel est une fiole d'huiles de bain parfumées d'une valeur de 1 gp.

- {@b Bedroom.} Il contient un ou deux lits (vous pouvez choisir de les rendre assez grands pour accueillir 1 à 4 personnes) avec des draps, des couvertures ou des couettes ; une table de nuit avec une lampe à huile ; un pot de chambre magique qui se vide tout seul pour chaque lit ; et jusqu'à quatre ensembles de vêtements de nuit et de pantoufles. Le composant matériel est un morceau de tissu, une pincée de sable et une plume.

- {@b Dining Room.} Il s'agit d'une table (que vous pouvez choisir de rendre assez grande pour accueillir de 2 à 8 personnes) avec un ensemble complet de vaisselle, de verres à boire, d'ustensiles, de napperons, de serviettes pliantes et de rince-doigts pour chaque couvert, ainsi que de 1 à 3 chandeliers à flamme continue. Le composant matériel est un service de table miniature.

- {@b Kitchen.} Il contient deux ensembles d'ustensiles de cuisine, une glacière magique qui conserve sa température pendant toute la durée de l'opération, une cuisinière et un four, deux grandes cheminées avec des broches, des casseroles, des poêles et des bols à mélanger divers, et deux grands bacs d'eau fraîche. Le composant matériel est un couteau de cuisine miniature et un pot en cuivre miniature.

- {@b Sitting Room.} Il contient des canapés, des fauteuils et des poufs, des tables d'appoint, une cheminée magique qui reste allumée pendant toute la durée du séjour, des verres et des tasses pour diverses boissons, jusqu'à trois lampes allumées en permanence et des tapis épais. Le composant matériel est un morceau d'acajou, un sac de thé et une pièce d'argent.

- {@b Throne Room.} Cela crée de un à trois trônes rembourrés sur une estrade ; un tapis qui mène à l'estrade ; une table de cour avec un marteau ; une douzaine de lampes sur pied éclairées par une flamme continue ; deux foyers magiques qui restent allumés pendant toute la durée du spectacle ; jusqu'à une douzaine de bannières avec le symbole de votre choix ; et jusqu'à six longs bancs. Le composant matériel est un morceau de fourrure de vison et un pied de tissu de satin.
- {@b Workshop.} Cela crée un à trois établis et jusqu'à six tabourets, une forge, un grand abreuvoir et deux boîtes à outils de votre choix.

Vous pouvez lancer ce sort à nouveau pendant qu'il est actif pour maintenir l'existence de la pièce pendant 24 heures supplémentaires. Vous pouvez créer une pièce permanente en lançant la même variante du sort au même endroit chaque jour pendant un an.

Si vous lancez ce sort à l'intérieur d'un demi-plan ou d'une structure magique, comme celle créée par la tour de Galder, vous pouvez emporter les objets n'importe où dans la structure ; ils ne sont pas limités au carré de 6 mètres. En revanche, les objets se dissiperont en fumée s'ils sont emportés à l'extérieur de la structure.
L'utilisation d'un matériau créé par ce sort comme composant matériel d'un autre sort entraîne l'échec de ce dernier.

spell.name: Create Spring

components.m: a bit of a freshwater plant and a water opal worth at least 500 gp

entries: Vous touchez le sol, et tant qu'il est constitué de terre ou de pierre non magique et non travaillée, une source d'eau douce jaillit. La source produit 100 gallons d'eau par minute dans la plupart des régions. Dans des conditions très sèches (comme un désert), elle produit un dixième d'eau par minute, et dans des conditions très humides (comme dans des marais ou une jungle, ou dans un plan d'eau existant), elle produit dix fois plus d'eau par minute.
Si vous le souhaitez, vous pouvez également choisir de faire de la source une source chaude ou une source minérale.
Vous pouvez créer une source permanente en lançant ce sort au même endroit chaque jour pendant un an.

spell.name: Hovering Road

components.m: a chunk of black marble and a loop of gold wire

entries: Une route faite de force sombre et chatoyante apparaît du sol ou du plancher. Elle fait 10 pieds de large, s'étend à 10 pieds devant vous et 20 pieds derrière vous. Elle s'élève à 1 pied au-dessus de la surface. La route voyage avec vous et vous pouvez utiliser votre action pour modifier son élévation, vers le haut ou vers le bas, de 20 pieds par round.
Une minute avant la fin du sort, la route commencera à s'effacer, vous laissant le temps de rejoindre un terrain plat avant de débarquer.

La route est un objet qui peut être endommagé. Chaque section de 10 pieds carrés a une CA de 20 et 50 points de vie, et est immunisée contre le poison et les dégâts psychiques et résistante aux dégâts de matraquage, de perçage et de coupure des attaques non magiques.
Vous pouvez lancer ce sort à nouveau pendant qu'il est actif pour maintenir l'existence de la route pendant une heure supplémentaire.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Lorsque vous lancez ce sort avec un emplacement de 8e niveau ou plus, sa durée augmente de 1 heure pour chaque niveau d'emplacement supérieur au 7e.

spell.name: Airboat
entries: Vous devez être à l'extérieur pour lancer ce sort, et le ciel doit être au moins légèrement nuageux. Vous désignez un nuage, qui descend immédiatement vers vous. Le nuage a les attributs d'un voilier (Classe d'armure 15, 300 points de vie, seuil de dégâts 15, peut transporter 100 tonnes de marchandises et 20 passagers).

et ressemble à une version nuageuse de n'importe quel type de navire que vous aimez. Vous contrôlez l'airboat par des commandes mentales (aucune action requise de votre part) et vous n'avez pas besoin d'autre équipage.

Il a une vitesse de vol de 90 pieds (60 pieds en naviguant contre le vent, et 120 pieds en naviguant avec le vent), et une vitesse de déplacement de 10 miles par heure 240 miles par jour). À votre tour, vous pouvez utiliser votre action pour faire monter ou descendre l'airboat jusqu'à 50 pieds ou pour faire un virage à 90 degrés. L'airboat n'est pas livré avec des armes, mais vous pouvez en installer.

Vous recevrez un signal mental dix minutes avant la fin du sort, vous permettant de le descendre au niveau du sol. Vous pouvez lancer ce sort à nouveau pendant qu'il est actif pour maintenir l'existence de l'airboat pendant 24 heures supplémentaires.

Vous pouvez également lancer ce sort sur le brouillard créé par un nuage mort, un nuage de brouillard, un nuage puant ou un sort ou effet magique similaire, plutôt que sur un nuage dans le ciel. Cependant, vous devez toujours être à l'extérieur pour le faire, et vous ne gagnez aucun des avantages originaux du sort ou de l'effet.

spell.name: Planar Link

components.m: a forked, metal rod worth at least 250 gp, attuned to a particular plane of existence, rare inks worth 100 gp and which are consumed in the casting, and an object originally from the plane to be contacted, which is also consumed

entries: Vous provoquez l'ouverture d'un portail sur un autre plan d'existence, ou vers un autre monde sur le Prime. Les symboles runiques du plan doivent être dessinés dans un cercle ou autour d'une porte, d'une fenêtre ou d'une autre arche à l'aide des encres rares. Vous pouvez spécifier une destination en termes généraux, comme le royaume de Mycelia dans Mechanus, et le portail apparaîtra dans ou près de cette destination ; dans ce cas, l'objet doit provenir de cette destination.

Lorsque vous créez le portail, vous pouvez spécifier une clé nécessaire pour l'utiliser. La clé peut être un objet ou un mot de passe. Lorsque la clé est utilisée, le portail s'ouvre pendant une minute, puis se referme. Une tige métallique fourchue, accordée à ce plan d'existence ou à un autre monde, comme celle utilisée comme composant matériel, peut également être utilisée pour ouvrir le portail.
Si vous lancez ce sort sur le même arc tous les 10 jours pendant un an, le portail devient permanent.

spell.name: Comet Strike
entries: Vous invoquez cinq éclats de glace qui tombent du ciel et frappent infailliblement un ou plusieurs points de votre choix à portée. Lorsque les éclats frappent, ils explosent en de puissantes salves de cristaux gelés. Chaque créature située à moins de 3 mètres du point d'impact doit effectuer un jet de sauvegarde de Dextérité, subissant {@damage 2d6} de dégâts de matraquage, {@damage 4d6} de dégâts de froid et {@damage 2d6} de dégâts de feu en cas d'échec, ou la moitié des dégâts en cas de réussite.

Au début de votre prochain tour, des morceaux de glace commencent à tomber dans un cylindre de 20 pieds de haut et de 30 pieds de rayon. La zone devient fortement obscurcie. Chaque créature dans le cylindre doit effectuer un jet de sauvegarde de Dextérité. Une créature subit {@damage 2d6} de dégâts de matraquage et {@damage 4d6} de dégâts de froid en cas d'échec, ou la moitié des dégâts en cas de réussite.
De plus, les cristaux de glace transforment les zones d'effet en terrain difficile pendant 10 minutes.

spell.name: Analyze Device
entries: Vous touchez un appareil mécanique non magique ou un objet avec des pièces mobiles et recevez une image de la façon dont cet appareil a été assemblé. Pendant toute la durée du contact, vous avez un avantage sur tous les jets nécessaires pour l'analyser, le réparer ou le démonter, et pendant l'heure suivante, vous avez également un avantage sur tous les jets nécessaires pour écrire ou dessiner les schémas de l'appareil. Si l'objet est une serrure, vous avez un avantage lorsque vous utilisez des outils de voleur pour la crocheter.
Si vous lancez ce sort deux fois ou plus sur un objet particulier avant de compléter votre prochain repos long, il y a 25% de chances cumulatives pour chaque lancer d'échouer.

spell.name: Consume Knowledge
entries: Vous touchez un livre non magique, un parchemin ou tout autre document écrit ou illustré et le "lisez" instantanément, en faisant entrer la connaissance dans votre esprit et en rendant le document source vierge dans le processus.

Pendant un jour, vous vous souvenez parfaitement des informations que vous avez consommées. Pendant les 7 jours suivants, votre mémoire est extrêmement bonne, mais pas parfaite, et vous avez un avantage sur les tests de capacité d'intelligence pour vous souvenir des informations provenant de la source.
L'écriture peut être restaurée dans le texte à l'aide d'un sort de souhait.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Lorsque vous lancez ce sort en utilisant un emplacement de sort de 6e niveau ou plus, vous pouvez affecter un livre supplémentaire pour chaque niveau d'emplacement au-dessus du 5e.

spell.name: Detect Curse
entries: Choisissez une créature ou un objet à portée lorsque vous lancez ce sort. Si la cible est maudite de quelque façon que ce soit, vous verrez une aura gris foncé et maladive autour d'elle.

Si vous vous concentrez sur la malédiction pendant toute sa durée, vous pouvez effectuer un test d'Arcane DC 15. En cas de réussite, vous pouvez apprendre des détails sur la malédiction, y compris quand la créature ou l'objet a été maudit et comment elle peut être brisée. Cela ne vous dira pas qui (ou quoi) a jeté la malédiction sur la cible, ni comment.

spell.name: Detect Metals and Minerals

components.m: a small magnet

entries: Vous détectez la présence de minerai, de pierres précieuses, de pierres ou de métal travaillé dans un rayon de 30 pieds autour de vous. À chacun de vos tours, vous pouvez vous concentrer sur un type spécifique de substance que vous souhaitez trouver (par exemple, vous pouvez chercher du minerai d'or brut, ou des objets en or manufacturés). Ce sort vous permettra également de connaître la quantité approximative de cette substance.

spell.name: Detect the Living
entries: Pour la durée, vous savez s'il y a une créature vivante dans un rayon de 30 pieds autour de vous, ainsi que l'endroit où la créature se trouve. Les créatures vivantes sont entourées d'une faible lueur, qui est plus faible chez les créatures proches de la mort. Vous pouvez choisir si le sort détectera ou ignorera les plantes normales. Ce sort ne détecte pas les créatures qui sont sous l'effet d'une feinte de mort ou d'un sort similaire. Le sort peut traverser la plupart des barrières, mais est bloqué par 1 pied de pierre, 1 pouce de métal commun, une fine feuille de plomb, ou 3 pieds de bois ou de terre.

spell.name: Dream Sight

components.m: a tick of incense worth at least 5 gp, which is burned while you cast the spell

entries: Lorsque vous lancez ce sort, vous tombez de {@condition unconscious} et votre esprit quitte votre corps et peut se rendre dans des lieux proches. Votre esprit est {@condition invisible} et silencieux, a une vitesse de vol de 90 pieds, ne peut pas toucher ou interagir avec quoi que ce soit, et est incapable de prendre des actions ou des réactions ou de lancer des sorts qui nécessitent des composantes verbales ou matérielles.

Lorsque vous êtes sous forme d'esprit, vous pouvez entendre et voir normalement, et vous pouvez vous déplacer à travers les objets et les autres créatures comme s'il s'agissait d'un terrain difficile. Si vous terminez votre tour à l'intérieur d'un objet, vous subissez {@damage 1d10} de dégâts psychiques.

Votre corps peut être réveillé si une créature utilise ses actions pour le réveiller, ou si elle subit des dégâts autres que psychiques. Vous pouvez également choisir de mettre fin au sort à tout moment et de vous réveiller.

Votre esprit peut être détecté avec le sort détecter le mal et le bien, et vous ne pouvez pas entrer dans une zone protégée par un cercle magique ou un hallow. En outre, vous pouvez être visé par des sorts tels que dissiper le mal et le bien. Dans ce cas, le sort prend fin prématurément et vous vous réveillez.

spell.name: Impart Knowledge
entries: En touchant la tête d'une créature, vous communiquez mentalement une idée, une image ou un élément d'information unique en un simple instant. Ce sort ne confère cependant à la cible aucune capacité spéciale ou aptitude à utiliser l'information de manière significative.

spell.name: Isolde's Answer

components.m: a focus worth at least 100 gp, such as a crystal ball or a silver mirror

entries: Vous posez une question simple de huit mots ou moins, telle que "où ai-je mis mes clés ?" ou "qui est la plus belle du pays ?" et une image fixe apparaîtra dans le foyer montrant une scène qui répond à votre question, à condition que la réponse puisse être trouvée dans un rayon de 160 km autour de votre position.

La question ne peut pas porter sur quelque chose qui s'est produit dans le passé (vous ne pouvez pas demander "qui a tué le roi ?") ou qui se produira dans le futur (vous ne pouvez pas demander "comment l'armée ennemie va-t-elle approcher du château ?"). Vous pouvez demander "où se trouve l'assassin du roi" (et peut-être voir l'image d'une taverne locale) ou "où se trouve l'armée ennemie" et voir une image de leur campement. L'image durera 1 minute ou jusqu'à ce que vous l'effaciez (aucune action requise).

L'image ne fournit aucun autre indice, comme l'emplacement ou l'identité. Si vous demandez "où ai-je mis mes clés" et que vous les avez laissées dans la poche de votre manteau, vous verrez une image de votre manteau, mais vous ne saurez pas où il se trouve actuellement ni dans quelle poche vous avez laissé les clés. Si vous demandez "qui est la plus belle du pays", vous verrez une image de la personne la plus belle (selon votre définition personnelle de "la plus belle"), mais vous n'apprendrez pas l'identité de cette personne ni où elle se trouve.

Contrairement au sort d'exploration, vous ne pouvez pas utiliser la réponse d'Isolde pour explorer un individu ou un lieu spécifique. Cependant, vous pouvez utiliser l'image montrée par ce sort comme une "image ou ressemblance" lorsque vous lancez le sort de scrutation.
Si vous lancez ce sort deux fois ou plus et que vous posez la même question avant d'effectuer votre prochain repos long, il y a 25% de chances cumulatives pour chaque lancer d'échouer.

spell.name: Last Image
entries: Vous touchez le cadavre d'une créature morte depuis moins d'une semaine et voyez ce qu'elle a vu au moment de sa mort.

Si la cible est morte d'une manière particulièrement horrible (décision du DM), vous devez réussir un jet de sauvegarde de Sagesse DC 10 ou être {@condition stunned} pendant 1 minute. Vous pouvez effectuer un nouveau jet de sauvegarde au début de chacun de vos tours, mettant fin à l'effet sur vous-même en cas de réussite.

spell.name: Patternweave

components.m: a small hand lens

entries: Vous gagnez la capacité de donner un sens au chaos apparent causé par les objets qui se sont brisés ou démontés. En regardant les morceaux d'un tout à travers la loupe, vous pouvez voir à quoi ressemblait l'objet original lorsqu'il était entier.
Les pièces doivent se trouver dans un carré de 3 mètres de côté, et vous devez avoir au moins deux tiers des pièces pour que le sort fonctionne.

spell.name: Read Object
entries: Vous lancez ce sort lorsque vous manipulez un objet et recevez une impression psychique du propriétaire actuel (ou le plus récent) de l'objet. Les informations potentielles comprennent la race du propriétaire, sa profession, son trait de personnalité général et toute émotion forte qu'il a ressentie à propos de l'objet ou lors de son utilisation.

Par exemple, si vous lancez ce sort sur une épée ayant appartenu à un mercenaire humain neutre, vous apprendrez peut-être que le propriétaire était un homme humain qui a pris de nombreuses vies avec son épée, mais qui ne l'a pas fait par passion. Ce sort ne permet pas de connaître le nom du propriétaire, son apparence physique ou sa localisation actuelle.
Si vous lancez ce sort deux fois ou plus avant d'avoir terminé un long repos, il y a 25 % de chances cumulatives que le sort se retourne contre vous et produise des informations totalement erronées.

spell.name: Relevation
entries: Votre divinité vous accorde des connaissances et des sens divins étonnants. Pour la durée, vous êtes entouré d'une faible lueur et gagnez les capacités suivantes :
• You have truesight to 120 feet.

• You can sense the presence of magic within 120 feet of you, seeing it as a faint aura around an object or creature that bears magic. You also automatically know if someone casts a spell within that range.
• You know if there is an aberration, celestial, elemental, fey, fiend, or undead within 120 feet of you.
• You automatically know if you hear a lie.
• You can speak and understand all languages.
• You can use your action to read the surface thought of a creature within range.
• When you make an Intelligence ability check, or a Wisdom (Insight) check, you can replace the number you roll with a 15.

spell.name: Sacred Guardian

components.m: a rose petal

entries: You can only cast this spell on a willing target. If the target takes any damage or is {@condition paralyzed} or {@condition poisoned} while this spell is active, you receive a mental ping, alerting you that the target is in danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell with a 3rd-level or higher spell slot, you will also receive a brief mental image of the cause of the danger.

spell.name: See Through Other Eyes
entries: For the duration, you can see through the eyes of another creature that is within range. The creature doesn't have to be willing or aware of your actions. While you must be able to see that creature while casting the spell, it's not required for the remainder of the spell. As an action, you can see through the creature's eyes until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses that creature has. During this time, you are blind with regard to your own senses.

spell.name: Shadow Play

components.m: a lit candle, which is consumed by the spell

entries: While casting this spell, you must darken a room or area that fits in a 30-foot cube so it is no brighter than dimly lit, then place a lit candle in its center. Then choose a one-hour period of time that occurred within the past 24 hours.

The shadows cast by the candle will then take the form of the shadows cast by the living occupants (not constructs or undead) of the room in that time period, and they will silently perform their actions in real time. Prematurely extinguishing the candle ends the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the size of cube you can affect increases by 10 feet on a side for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Shandaril's Tracer
entries: You place an {@condition invisible} rune on an object you touch. At any point after, you can spend 1 minute to concentrate on the rune. You will then learn the object's approximate distance, direction, and condition. The mask option of Nystul's magic aura can be used to block this spell. If you cast this spell on the same object every day for 30 days, the spell becomes permanent.

spell.name: Teleport Tracer

time.condition: taken when a creature you see within range teleports

entries: When you see a creature teleport away, whether through the use of a spell, magic item, innate ability, or other method, you can use this spell to locate its destination. The information received by this spell counts as 'Viewed Once' for purposes of the teleport spell, if you are not otherwise familiar with the destination locale.

spell.name: Trailfinder
entries: While this spell is active, you have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to follow creature's tracks. If the creature was under the effects of the pass without trace spell, you may search for the tracks, but you don't get advantage on the roll.

spell.name: Warp Sense
entries: This spell allows you to sense the presence of and location to gates and portals to other planes of existence, teleportation circles, arcane gates, and similar portal.

Once such a portal is detected, you can spend an action concentrating on it and making a DC 15 Intelligence (Arcana) check to determine where the portal leads or if a key or sigil sequence is required to use the portal. If you are in within 30 feet of the portal or can see it in operation, you have advantage on the check.

spell.name: Bleeding Touch
entries: Make a ranged spell attack against a creature you see within range. On a hit, the creature takes {@damage 1d4} slashing damage and the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by 1 as a gaping, bleeding wound appears on it. The reduction lasts until the creature takes a short or long rest or receives any magical healing. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

If used against a creature that doesn't have blood, is a construct, elemental, or undead, or is protected by a periapt of wound closure or similar form of protection, this spell only inflicts slashing damage and doesn't reduce the creature's hit point maximum.

This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} and the amount by which the target's hit point maximum is reduced is increased by 1 when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4} slashing and hp maximum is reduced by 2), 11th level ({@dice 3d4} and hp maximum is reduced by 3) and 17th level ({@dice 4d4} and hp maximum is reduced by 4).

spell.name: Animate Warrior

components.m: a drop of your blood and two silver coins, which are consumed by the spell

entries: You point to a humanoid corpse within range and animate it, turning it into a {@creature zombie}  under your control (the DM has the creature's game statistics). For the spell's duration, the zombie is under your control.

On each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to mentally command the zombie. You decide what action it will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete.
When the spell ends, the zombie collapses and it can't be affected by this spell again.

spell.name: Bone Blade

components.m: A sharp shard of bone

entries: The material component for this spell is transformed into a large sword made of bone. This magic sword lasts until the spell ends. It counts as a simple melee weapon with which you are proficient. It deals {@damage 2d6} slashing damage on a hit and has the finesse, light, and thrown properties (range 20/60). If you strike an undead creature with this weapon, it must make a Constitution saving throw, taking an additional {@damage 4d8} force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. In addition, until the end of your next turn, the undead can't regain hit points and has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws to avoid being turned.
If you wield the sword yourself, the duration is 1 minute. If you give the sword to another creature to wield, the duration is concentration, up to 1 minute.

spell.name: Garinthrall's Hideous Leech
entries: A shimmering, dark gray arrow streaks towards a target within range and bursts in a spray of toxic goo. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d4} acid damage and {@damage 1d4} poison damage, and the goo transforms into a leech-like form that burrows under the target's clothing and armor and latches onto its skin.

At the end of each of the target's turns, the leech eats away at the target, inflicting an additional {@damage 1d4} acid damage. The target or another creature can use its action to make a Strength check, using your spell save DC, to remove the leech from the target's body. This causes the spell to end.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: You cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd-level or higher, the acid damage (both initial and later) increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Azura's Soul Whip

components.m: a length of braided tendon

entries: You create a long whip of shimmering ebony energy that lashes out at your command towards a creature in range. On each of your turns, you can make a melee spell attack against the target. If the attack hits, the creature {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage and {@damage 3d6} psychic damage and is {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained} (escape DC equal to your spell save DC) until the start of your next turn. You also regain hit points equal to half the amount of necrotic damage dealt. If the creature you struck was undead, you instead gain temporary hit points equal to half the psychic damage dealt. You can also pull the creature up to 15 feet closer to you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a 6th level or higher spell slot, the necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Hovering Skull

components.m: a humanoid's tooth

entries: You create a Tiny skull with sharp fangs and glowing eye sockets that hovers above you (it otherwise appears to be a skull from your species). The skull is an object with AC 15 and hit points equal to your level + your spellcasting ability modifier. When you cast the spell and as a bonus action on your subsequent turns, you can move the skull up to 30 feet and have it perform one of the following options:

• You can see through the skull's eye sockets and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn. The skull has darkvision to 60 feet, and you gain that benefit. During this time, you are deaf and blind with regard to your own senses.
• You can speak through the skull. The message is spoken in a raspy, hollow-sounding version of your own voice. You can't
• You can cause the skull to bite a creature within 5 feet of it. It uses your spell attack modifier and inflicts {@damage 4d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier piercing damage.

• You can cause the skull to scream. Each creature within 10 feet of the skull must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for the spell's duration. While {@condition frightened} by this spell, a creature must move away from you by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have a line of sight to you, the creature can make a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends for that creature.

• You can cause the skull to exhale purple or green flames in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one
If you end your turn with the skull 120 feet away from you or farther, the skull vanishes and the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 5th-level or higher, its bite or fire breath inflicts an additional {@damage 1d6} damage for each slot level above 4th.
In addition, if you cast this spell with a spell slot of 6th-level or higher, the duration increases to Concentration, up to 10 minutes.

spell.name: Infected Wounds

components.m: a bloodstone worth at least 50 gp

entries: You target a creature that is not an elemental, construct, or undead and that is not at full hit points and force it to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is cursed and its wounds are infected. For the duration, the creature can't regain hit points by nonmagical means, and magical healing only restores half as many hit points as normal. Also, the creature has disadvantage on Constitution saving throws to avoid catching any disease. A lesser restoration will suspend this curse for 1 minute, during which the target can be healed normally.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the duration increases by 48 hours for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Putrefaction

components.m: a bit of rotten meat

entries: You choose a point within range and all food within a 15-foot-radius sphere of it spoil, all open liquids become fouled, wood and corpses rot, metals rust, and open containers of holy water become plain water. Maggots and other Tiny verminous creatures spontaneously generate. Only nonmagical objects are affected by this spell.

For one minute after you cast this spell, any creature that enters the area or starts its turn in it and that has half or fewer of its normal hit point must make a Constitution saving throw or develop filth fever (as per the contagion spell). In addition, during this time, any creature that was in the area can't regain hit points through nonmagical mean.

spell.name: Bloodgloat

time.condition: which you take when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points

entries: This horrific spell allows you to convert a death into a powerful triumph for you. For the duration, all friendly creatures in the area have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}, gain a number of temporary hit points equal to twice your level, and may roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to one attack roll they make. In addition, all hostile creatures in the area have disadvantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} and must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract that number from their next attack roll.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 6th or 7th-level spell slot, the die increases to a {@dice d6}. When you cast it using an 8th or 9th-level spell slot, the die increases to a {@dice d8}.

spell.name: Drive Insensate

components.m: A leather hood

entries: You cause a foe to lose all of their senses. Choose a creature that you can see within range to make a Constitution saving throw. If it fails, the creature is {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, and can't taste, smell, or feel anything for the duration. The creature can make a new saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Graft

components.m: a potion of healing and 1,000 gp worth of powdered moonstone, which the spell consumes

entries: With this spell, you may take a humanoid limb or other body part that had been severed no more than one hour ago, and graft it onto a willing humanoid's stump (which doesn't have to have been freshly-severed). The recipient must be missing the same limb or body part; this spell doesn't allow you to grant a creature extra body parts, nor does it allow you to graft body parts to places where they aren't supposed to go (i.e., you can't graft an arm to the stump of a leg or coming out the middle of a chest), nor does it allow you to graft body parts onto a recipient that doesn't normally have that part (you can't add wings to a wingless person, for example). The "donor" must be no more than one size category smaller or larger than the target. Only one body part may be replaced per casting of the spell. Other body parts may be replaced at the DM's discretion. If gentle repose or preserve from decay (q.v.) is cast on the body part, the duration of that spell doesn't count against the length of time the body part may be severed.

• {@b Arms and Hands.} If the body part you are grafting has claws or other natural attacks, you also gain a similar attack. You inflict {@damage 1d4} + your Strength or Dexterity slashing damage. This does not increase the number of attacks you may make each turn.
• {@b Legs and Feet.} If the donor had a walking speed of 50 feet or more, or had the Running Leap or Standing Leap trait, the recipient gains that speed or trait only if it had both legs replaced.

• {@b Sensory Organ.} If the donor had blindsight, darkvision, or the Keen Sight trait, the recipient also gains that trait only if it had both eyes replaced. If the body part is an eye, ear, or nose, and the donor had the Keen Hearing or Keen Smell trait, the recipient also gains that trait.
• {@b Internal Organ.} If the donor had immunity to poison damage or the {@condition poisoned} condition, the recipient gains advantage on saving throws to avoid being {@condition poisoned}.

Upon receiving the graft, the recipient must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the graft still takes, but it comes with a minor quirk: it may have a frequent tic, ache, look very unsightly or be misshapen (but still work perfectly well), might bleed a strange color, cause a slight limp, or come with a strange personality trait related to the original owner in some way. The quirk may be annoying but doesn't otherwise cause any mechanical penalties to the recipient.

{@b Prosthetics.} You may also cast this spell using an artificial prosthesis made from wood, metal, or other nonliving material. The prosthesis animates and can't be removed without first successfully casting dispel magic on it. It uses the target's Strength and Dexterity scores and must be made for a creature of its size category. The recipient can use the limb as normal. Sensations perceived through the prosthetic are slightly muted, but the recipient isn't at risk of having a quirk.

spell.name: Lifesteal
entries: You touch a creature other than a construct or undead and steal some of its life force. Make a melee spell attack. On a success, the creature takes {@damage 6d8} necrotic damage and you hold its life force in your hand, where it takes the form of a glowing, silvery-gray orb. On a subsequent turn, you may then touch a different creature (which may be yourself). That creature gains temporary hit points equal to twice the amount of damage taken. If you don't give the life force to another creature by the time the spell ends, the orb vanishes and the life force is lost.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Throbbing Bones

components.m: a small bone that has been snapped in half

entries: You target a living creature you can see within range and cause its bones to throb and pulsate inside of its body. A creature that doesn't have bones (such as oozes and invertebrates) isn't affected by this spell.

At the start of each of its turns, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, it takes {@damage 4d6} bludgeoning damage, its speed can't be higher than 10 feet, and it has disadvantage on all Strength and Dexterity ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, it takes half damage and its speed can't be higher than 20 feet, but it doesn't have disadvantage on any rolls.
If the creature succeeds on three saving throws, the effect ends. The saves don't have to be consecutive.

spell.name: Animate Dead Monster

components.m: a drop of blood, a piece of flesh, and a pinch of bone dust

entries: This spell creates an undead servant. Choose a pile of bones or a corpse of an aberration, beast, dragon, humanoid, giant, monstrosity, or plant of CR 4 or lower that is within range. Your spell animates it as a skeletal monster if you choose bones or zombie monster if you choose a corpse. Such a creature has the same statistics of a living creature of the same type, with the following changes:

{@b Skeletal monsters} have Intelligence 6 (-2), unless it was already lower, are vulnerable to bludgeoning damage, immune to poison damage, {@condition exhaustion}, and the {@condition poisoned} condition, and have darkvision to 60 feet. The skeletal monster's type changes to undead.

{@b Zombie monsters} have Intelligence 3 (-4), unless it was already lower, are immune to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition, and have darkvision to 60 feet. They also have the Undead Fortitude Trait. The zombie monster's type changes to undead.

As undead, the creature doesn't need to breathe, eat, or sleep, and it loses any trait, such as Amphibious, that assumes living physiology. If it had the Innate Spellcasting trait, it loses it. There is a 50% chance it will lose a magical or supernatural trait or action that it has.

On each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to mentally command any creature you made with this spell if the creature is within 60 feet of you (if you control multiple creatures, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete.

The creature is under your control for 24 hours, after which it stops obeying any command you've given it. To maintain control of the undead creature for another 24 hours, you must cast this spell on the creature again before the current 24-hour period ends. This use of the spell reasserts your control over up to four creatures you have animated with this spell, rather than animating a new one. You can also reassert control of undead creatures by casting animate dead on them.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the CR of the creature you animate increases by 1 for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Call Spirit

components.m: burning incense and powdered silver worth at least 500 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You must cast this spell at night, inside a circle, you inscribe using the powdered silver and incense. You call upon the spirit of a deceased individual whose name you know, regardless of where the deceased's body lies or how long it has been dead. There's a chance you might get a different spirit anyway (DM's choice), unless you also have an object belonging to the spirit.

When the spirit appears, you can ask it up to ten questions, and it can take no other actions besides answering your questions. Unlike speak with the dead, the spirit may have gained additional knowledge in the afterlife and isn't limited to what it knew in life, and it's also capable of speculation. The spirit will generally tell the truth as it understands it, but may decide to lie if you are hostile to it, if it recognizes you as an enemy, or if it is contrary or evil-minded. The DM will choose if and how it answers.

If the spirit doesn't know the answer to a question, you can order it to search the afterlife for the answer. If the question is not to its liking, or searching for the answer may be harmful to the spirit, it may attempt to refuse by making a Charisma saving throw. If the DM doesn't know the spirit's Charisma modifier, assume it's +3. This search take {@dice 1d12} hours.

The spell lasts until you have asked all ten questions, you dismiss the spirit as a bonus action, or you cast this spell again. A dispel evil and good spell or similar magic will also banish the spirit, ending the spell early.

spell.name: Fellblade

components.m: a drop of your blood and a piece of cold iron

entries: You call up a smoky gray blade made of dark energy into your hand. This magic sword lasts until the spell ends. It counts as a simple melee weapon with which you are proficient. It deals {@damage 6d6} necrotic damage on a hit and has the finesse, light, and thrown properties (range 20/60).
If you drop the weapon or throw it, it dissipates at the end of the turn. Thereafter, while the spell persists, you can use a bonus action to cause the sword to reappear in your hand.
In addition, when you successfully hit a creature with this sword, choose one of the following options:
{@b Drain.} The blade drinks deeply of your targets life and siphons some of that energy to you. You regain hit points equal to half the amount of necrotic damage dealt.

{@b Curse.} The blade places a curse on your target. Until the start of your next turn, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls made against you, and disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with one ability check of your choice.

spell.name: Soul Safe

components.m: A piece of jet worth 100 GP

entries: You indicate a humanoid within range and force it to make a Charisma saving throw. If it fails, you steal a portion of its soul and place it within the jet. The creature whose soul you have captured will feel slightly weak and have low spirits while this spell is in effect. For the duration, the creature doesn't regain hit points after a long rest unless it spends Hit Dice to do so, and it has disadvantage on Intelligence, wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

If you are holding the jet in which a creature's soul-fragment is held, you can cast spells on the jet, and it will affect the target is if it were within range. You must be on the same plane of existence, however.

The jet is an object with AC 13 and 5 hit points. It is resistant to all damage except for bludgeoning and thunder damage. If it is destroyed, the soul-fragment immediately reunites with its body. If the creature had died in the meantime, the soul-fragment will journey to rejoin the rest of the soul. At the DM's discretion, a creature that died while part of its soul has been removed by this spell may be more likely to return as a form of undead.

You can cast this spell again while it is active to maintain the soul safe for another week. Even though this spell only takes a portion of the creature's soul, a creature can only be affected by one casting of this spell at a time.

spell.name: Unliving Identity
entries: You touch an undead creature and for the duration, it regains the memories and personality of its life. Its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores return to their original total (if the creature's original attributes are unknown, assume they were 10), and it returns to its original alignment.
At the DM's discretion, the undead may have to make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it develops a form of Indefinite Madness (as per Dungeon Master's Guide, Chapter 8: Running the Game).

When the spell ends, the undead creature loses its memories and personality over the course of an hour, unless you cast this spell on it again. Casting this spell on the same creature once every 10 days for a year makes the memories and personality permanent.

spell.name: Create Shade

components.m: 1,000 gp worth of powdered onyx and diamond, and rare poisons taken from the Shadowfell worth 500 gp, both of which the spell consumes

entries: You infuse a willing dragon, giant, humanoid, or monstrosity with the dark energies of the Shadowfell and transform that creature into a shade, a being that is not quite alive but also not quite undead. The {@creature shade} gains many abilities (most of which don't work in bright light), and while it can be slain, it is otherwise immortal.
{@b Shade Template:}
Shades tend to be moody and cynical, and driven by their dedication to the powers of the night. Their skin, hair, and eyes are leeched of color and turn ashy in both color and texture.
A shade has the following traits:

{@b Type.} Although technically living, the shade is treated as undead for all purposes, and its type changes to undead. It still needs to breathe, drink, eat, and sleep, but only needs half as much drink, food, or sleep. The shade is incapable of reproducing and if slain, only a true resurrection or wish will bring it back from the dead (it will no longer be a shade in that case). It is capable of being affected by spells and other effects that target either undead or creatures of its original type.
{@b Alignment.} Nearly all shades are of neutral or evil alignment.
{@b Speed.} The shade's speeds increase by 10 feet when in dim light or darkness. When in bright light, its speeds decrease by 10 feet.
{@b Proficiencies.} The shade is proficient in Stealth, and when in dim light or darkness, it may use double its proficiency bonus.
{@b Resistances and Immunities.} The shade is resistant to cold, necrotic, and poison damage, and it is immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition.

{@b Senses.} The shade has darkvision to 120 feet. Innate Spellcasting. The shade's spellcasting ability is Charisma. While in dim light or darkness, the shade can cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
1/day each: blur, dancing shadows (q.v.), darkness, dimension door (start and ending points must both be within darkness)
{@b Light Sensitivity.} While in bright light, the shade has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
{@b Living Shadow.} While in dim light or darkness, the shade has resistance to damage that isn't force, psychic, or radiant, and it can take the Hide action as a bonus action.
{@b Magic Resistance.} While in dim light or darkness, the shade has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
{@b Regeneration.} When in dim light or darkness, the shade regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.
{@b Shadow Vision.} Magical darkness doesn't impede the shade's vision.
{@b Soulless.} The shade can't be affected by any spell or magical effect that would affect its soul or spirit, or that would lower its hit point maximum or attributes.
{@b Turn Immunity.} The shade is immune to any effect that turns undead.

spell.name: Revenance

components.m: 100 gp worth of incense, which is burned when you cast the spell

entries: You touch the corpse of a humanoid that has died from violence within the past week and cause it to rise as a {@creature revenant}.

The revenant is aware of who killed it and will seek revenge against its killer. The revenant is neutral towards you and your allies. It won't attempt to harm you unless you interfere with its quest for vengeance. You have no control over its actions.

spell.name: Soul Shift

components.m: a gem worth at least 500 gp, which is consumed by the spell

entries: You transfer your mind and soul into a corpse of your choosing that is within 30 feet of you. Once you possess the corpse, you control it. Your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the creature, though you retain your alignment and your Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. You retain the benefit of your own class features. If the corpse had any class levels, you can't use any of its class features.

You are undead and do not need to breathe, drink, eat, or sleep. You have resistance to necrotic damage and are immune to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned} damage. You also gain the following trait:
Turn Resistance: You have advantage on saving throws against being turned.

Your body will appear as the corpse's did and won't further decay. However, any wounds or other marks that were on the original corpse will remain, even after healing to full hit points. You are not a lich and you do not gain any other special traits for becoming undead besides those listed above.

You may choose for your original body to die or to animate as a zombie. If you choose the latter, the zombie will have none of your class abilities but will retain your former Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, saving throw proficiencies, and hit points.

spell.name: Deathshroud

components.m: 500 gp worth of crushed black opal and smoky quartz

entries: You draw upon the Negative Plane to infuse you with necrotic energies, surrounding you with a dark and shadowy aura. While this spell is in effect, you gain the following benefits:
• You are immune to necrotic damage, and your hit point maximum can't be reduced.
• Ranged attacks made against you have disadvantage.
• A creature that touches you or hits you with a melee attack while within 5 feet of you takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage.

• You may use your action to touch a creature and drain its life. Make a melee spell attack. On a success, the creature takes {@damage 10d6} necrotic damage, its hit point maximum is reduced by that amount, and you regain hit points equal to half the amount of necrotic damage dealt.

spell.name: Year Stealing

components.m: a unicorn's horn worth wrapped in silver, worth at least 5,000 gp and a drop of blood, spittle, or other bodily fluid from your target

entries: You target a creature whose blood, spittle, or other bodily fluid you possess and force that creature to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature ages {@dice 2d6} years (or {@dice 4d6} years, if the creature has a lifespan of 400 or more years), and you stop aging for that period of time.
When you finish casting this spell, you must make a DC 15 Intelligence (Arcana) check. On a failure, the unicorn's horn crumbles into dust.

spell.name: Earthwrack
entries: With this evil spell, you cause an area of nonmagical, unworked earth to become barren and blighted. Healthy plants wither and die within a few days of this spell being cast, although there is a chance (DM's discretion) that some will transform into blights instead. Seeds planted there will either not grow or grow into blights.
This spell can be removed by first casting remove curse at the effect's center, then casting plant growth over 8 hours. A wish will also end the effect.

spell.name: Heart of Stone

components.m: a life-sized heart carved out of a black stone, worth at least 5,000 gp

entries: You replace your heart with the stone heart used as the material component for this spell, and your own heart appears in your hand, still beating even as it pumps no blood. Your real heart is a Tiny object with AC 7, hit points equal to your caster level + your spellcasting attribute bonus, and is immune to psychic damage. As long as your heart remains intact, you have the following benefits:
• You don't age, and you need half as much air, drink, food, and sleep as you normally do.
• You are resistant to necrotic damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and are immune to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition.
• You have advantage on Constitution saving throws.

• You regenerate lost and severed body parts. Severed body parts, except for your head, are restored after 2 minutes, and if you have the severed part and hold it to the stop, the part instantly rejoins the stump. Otherwise, the severed body part regrows after you finish a long rest.
However, you don't regain hit points through long rests unless you spend Hit Dice to do so.

If your real heart is touched, you receive a mental image of the creature that touched it. If it's destroyed, you instantly die and can't be brought back to life by any means short of a true resurrection or wish.
At the end of the year, your real heart reappears in your chest and the stone heart reappears in your hand. You may reuse the stone heart if you wish.

spell.name: Bear Hug

components.m: A bit of bear's fur

entries: You crush your enemies in a powerful bear hug. As part of the action used to cast this spell, you must make a melee attack to grapple one creature within range; otherwise, the spell ends. On a hit, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape DC equal to your spell save DC) and is {@condition restrained}. When you cast this spell and as an action on each of your turns for the duration, you can squeeze the target, inflicting an additional {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage plus your spellcasting ability modifier plus your Strength modifier. While this spell is in effect, you can't use your hands to perform any other action, unless you have more than two hands.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th-level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th-level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th-level ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Adhesion

components.m: a pinch of powdered horse hoof

entries: You touch two solid, inanimate objects and cause them to stick to each other. The two objects can be separated only through brute force, requiring a successful Strength (Athletics) check against your spell save DC. If the two items are wrested apart before the spell ends, then they will re-adhere if brought into contact with each other again.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd-level or higher, the duration increases by one hour for each slot level above 1st. In addition, when you use a 4th-level or higher spell slot, the Strength check is made with disadvantage.

spell.name: Bladeleap

components.m: A pinch of iron fillings

entries: This spell causes a dagger, dart, or other simple thrown weapon that you're holding to leap out of your hand and fly at a foe you see within range. It will then attack the target, using your spell attack modifier to hit and damage rolls, then return to your hand. If your hand isn't empty, it hovers in the air next to you. During each of your turns, you may use a bonus action to send the weapon flying to a new target. You must make a new ranged spell attack each time to hit.

spell.name: Cloud Stairway
entries: You shape existing nonmagical cloud, fog, or smoke that is within range cause it to shape itself into the form of a spiral staircase up to 20 feet tall and either 5 or 10 feet wide (your choice). You and any number of creatures you choose can climb the staircase; to all others, it's as insubstantial as normal mist.
When the spell ends, the staircase vanishes abruptly; any creature still on it falls.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the maximum length of the staircase increases by up to 20 feet for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Coalstone

components.m: A fire agate worth 10 GP

entries: You transform the fire agate you hold in your hand into a coalstone, a small stone that sheds bright light to a 10-foot radius and dim light to a further 10 feet. This coalstone is hot enough that, if touched to bare skin or a flammable object for a full round, it inflicts 1 fire damage and will set that object alight. The coalstone can be placed inside of a fireproof container when not in use.

spell.name: Color

components.m: a drop of dye

entries: You permanently change the surface color of a 5-foot square of cloth, leather, paper, or other flexible material. If you wish to create multiple colors or patterns, you must concentrate on the desired result; otherwise, the material is dyed a single color.

spell.name: Control Smoke and Vapor

components.m: a small glass tube

entries: Until this spell ends, you control vapor, fog, mist, and smoke inside an area you choose that fits inside a 30-foot cube. You can choose from any of the following effects when you cast this spell. As a bonus action on your turn, you can repeat the same effect or choose a different one. You can have up to three its effects active at a time.
• You cause the vapor to move up to 30 feet in any direction.
• You cause the vapor to form into simple shapes and animate at your direction.
• You change the vapor's color or opacity. You can cause the vapor to vanish completely (this ends the spell), or to lightly or heavily obscure the area. This change lasts for 1 hour.
• Cause the fog to thicken, turning its area into difficult terrain.
• You can cause the vapor to condense and produce a quarter-inch of rain in its area. This ends the spell.

If the vapor was caused by a spell, such as fog cloud or cloudkill you must first succeed on a spellcasting ability check, with the DC being the caster's spell save DC. You don't have to make a check if you created the fog. You can't use this spell to make cloudkill or similar spells less (or more) deadly, but you can attempt to make it vanish.

If the vapor is actually a creature, such as a vampiric mist, a vampire in mist form, or a creature in gaseous form, the creature must make a Strength saving throw. On success, it isn't altered. This spell does not inflict damage, and the creature can reverse any changes you make on its turn by using a bonus action.

spell.name: Copy

components.m: a drop of ink

entries: You touch a nonmagical map, letter, or sheet of paper on which there is writing, then a blank sheet of paper (or parchment, vellum, etc.) of similar size, and an exact copy of the original is made. It requires an Intelligence (Investigation) check, using your spell save DC, to determine which is the copy and which is the original.

spell.name: Crier's Boon

components.m: a piece of vellum, rolled into a cone

entries: With this spell, a willing creature you cast this upon can speak loudly and clearly enough to be easily heard over 200 feet away, regardless of any ambient noise.

spell.name: Curse of Tongues

components.m: a piece of knotted string

entries: You curse a creature so that its speech becomes completely unintelligible unless it makes a successful Wisdom saving throw. For the duration, the creature can't speak and can't cast spells with verbal components.

spell.name: Drawmij's Light Step

components.m: a pit of cat fur and a duck's feather

entries: You or a willing creature you touch gain a limited form of levitation. For the duration, your move increases by 5 feet, you gain the ability to walk across the ground without disturbing the surface, you ignore difficult terrain, and you can walk across liquids as if they were difficult terrain. This spell doesn't protect you from taking damage by walking across lava or other dangerous surfaces, but it does prevent you from triggering traps that require you to step on them.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Erase
entries: You remove any writing in the area from an area equal to the size of a normal sheet of paper, leaving the surface clean and unused. The surface must be paper, parchment, or a similar surface.

If the writing is magical in nature, such as from a spell scroll, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the writing is erased. If you fail your check, and the writing was a glyph of warding, sigil (q.v.), or similar writing-based trap, you set off the trap.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you may also remove writing that is carved or engraved in stone, metal, or a similar hard surface.

spell.name: Float/Sink

time.condition: taken when a creature within range enters water

components.m: a cork

entries: Choose an object that can fit in a 5-foot cube, or a Medium or smaller creature, that is in water or other liquid and choose one of the following options:

{@b Float.} The target becomes very buoyant. It will remain on the water's surface, unless prevented from doing so, such as by having heavyweights attached (which must weigh at least half as much as what the target actually weighs).
When you cast this spell in this manner, the duration is 1 hour.

{@b Sink.} The target immediately begins to sink, falling to the bottom of the body of water it is in as if it had weights attached to it. If the target is a creature, it has disadvantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made to swim and its swim speed (if any) is halved.
When you cast this spell in this manner, the duration is Concentration, up to 1 minute.

spell.name: Weapon of the Earth

components.m: a chunk of iron ore

entries: You can transform a chunk of earth or stone into a magical melee weapon of a type in which you are proficient. The chunk of earth or stone must weigh at least as much as the weapon you wish to make. If a creature other than you attempts to use the weapon, it crumbles back into earth or stone and the spell ends. The weapon is considered magical.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 3rd or 4th-level spell slot, the weapon gains a +1 bonus to hit and damage. When you cast it using a 5th or 6th-level spell slot, the weapon gains a +2 bonus. When you use a 7th-level or higher spell slot, the weapon gains a +3 bonus.

spell.name: Uncontrolled Weather
entries: You summon dramatic weather that is wildly inappropriate to the climate or season. You must be outdoors to cast this spell, but you don't have to remain outdoors for the spell's duration. You have no control over the type of weather this spell produces. The DM will roll a {@dice d8} on the table below to determine the weather. Every hour, there is a 50% chance that the weather will change. It takes {@dice 1d4 × 10} minutes for the new conditions to take effect.

rows: Strong wind and rain, hail, and snow
Cold ground fog with complete cover

spell.name: Warp
entries: You target an object, or section of a larger object, that weighs no more than 50 pounds and is made of nonmagical metal, stone, or plant material, and make a twisting motion with your hands. At the same time, the material itself is warped and twisted into uselessness.

If the object is protected by magic but not in itself magical (e.g., a nonmagical door on which arcane lock or glyph of warding has been cast) you must first make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a failure, the magical protection takes effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the weight of the object that you can affect increases by 50 pounds for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Wood Shape

components.m: a miniature carpenter's adze

entries: You touch a wood or grass object of Medium size or smaller or a section of wood or other plant material no more than 5 feet in any dimension and form it into any shape that suits your purpose. So, for example, you could shape a log into a chair, a chest, or a bookcase, or make a small passage through a wall, as long as the wall is less than 5 feet thick. You could also shape a wood door or its frame to seal the door shut. The object you create can have up to two hinges and a latch, but finer mechanical detail isn't possible.
You can't use this spell on a living plant.

spell.name: Cloudscape
entries: You shape existing nonmagical cloud, fog, or smoke that fits in a 1,000-foot cube solid enough to support any weight for the duration. The solidified cloud feels firm but plush, like a thick mattress. The cloud itself remains afloat in the air and will drift with the wind as usual. You can also shape the cloud to form images or words, but you aren't capable of producing fine detail.

spell.name: Disfigure
entries: Your target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be cursed, its face and body covered in scars, boils, warts, and masses of twisted flesh. The creature becomes utterly repulsive. While cursed, the creature has disadvantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks and advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks against creatures that can see it. It also has disadvantage on Constitution saving throws to avoid catching diseases. In addition, any reaction roll made to determine how others react to the target is made at disadvantage (as per Dungeon Master's Guide, Chapter 8: Social Interaction).
At the end of every 30 days, the creature can repeat its saving throw against this spell. If it succeeds on its saving throw, the spell ends.
A remove curse, greater restoration, or heal spell will end the effect.

spell.name: Earthmaw

components.m: a tooth from a predatory animal

entries: You cause a patch of nonmagical, unworked earth or stone 10 feet across to form into a gigantic mouth with sharp stone teeth. The mouth springs forth on a short neck and attacks a creature you choose within 10 feet of it. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the creature takes {@damage 5d10} piercing damage and must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the creature is swallowed whole.

While swallowed, the creature is {@condition restrained} and can't breathe, and is at risk of suffocating (as per Player's Handbook chapter 8, Environment). The escape DC is equal to your spell save DC. On a success, the creature is no longer {@condition restrained} and is able to dig intself out. The creature can also be dug out by creatures who are on the surface.
After the attack, whether it hits or misses, the mouth returns to the ground and fades away.

spell.name: Eyes of the Sun
entries: Your eyes burn as bright as the sun for the spell's duration. You shed bright light to 20 feet and dim light to a further 20 feet. This light is sunlight. OneWhen you cast this spell, and as a bonus action on each subsequent turn, you may target one creature you can see within 60 feet of you that you can see. That creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. Creatures with the Sunlight Sensitivity or similar trait have disadvantage on this save.

A creature may make a new saving throw at the start of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that succeeds on its save can't be targeted by this casting of the spell again.

spell.name: Glass Shape

components.m: a small crystal lens

entries: You touch a glass object of Medium size or smaller or a section of glass no more than 5 feet in any dimension and form it into any shape that suits your purpose.

So, for example you could shape a pane of glass into a blade, a glass case, or a statue, or make a passage through a window. You could also shape a window to seal shut. The object you create can have up to two hinges and a latch, but finer mechanical detail isn't possible.
You can also use this spell to transform up to 100 pounds of sand into 75 pounds of glass.

spell.name: Hasten Growth
entries: You point at a beast, dragon, giant, humanoid, monstrosity, or plant creature, or normal plants that fit within a 10-foot square and force it to make a Constitution saving throw. Normal plants automatically fail this roll. If it fails, it ages by your choice of {@dice 2d6} months or {@dice 2d6} years. The creature is unaffected on a success.
